intro: Crepis ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, cylindrical seed heads. Crepis ellenbeckii is often found in alpine and steppe regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
